result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason R Rothenhoefer was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied and balance shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing December 1, 2016 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to a county jail convenient to employment or residence or to a jail in another state.
Effective upon licensure.  Attached is an information sheet for the defendant regarding installation.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and safety plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason R Rothenhoefer

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Statements by counsel.  Court enters judgment.
Letter received from Atty Kenitz
Sentencing hearing on October 19, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.   Court advises Amended Criminal Complaint and finds probable cause.  State indicates upon plea to Count 1, recommend Count 2 be dismissed for read-in.  Upon successful completion of TAD program recommend on Count 1 is 25 days jail with Huber, unsuccessful recommend 120 days jail with Huber; Fine of $1,568.00 (DNA); AODA; 18 mo. rev.; 18 mo. IID upon licensure; DNA sample.  Defendant admits prior conviction.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1, Court dismissed Count 2 for read-in.  Defendant admits prior conviction.  Court accepts the plea to Count 1.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
